During the period of falling in love, each time that we met and á
especially when we had not met for a long time.

When I was driving home after  several days of hard work, there á
was a motorist ahead of me who was driving at 50 km/hour and á

When I lost the person who meant the most to me.

When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had applied á

When I was talking to HIM at a party for the first time in a long while and a friend came and interrupted us and HE left.

When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party á
with them.

[ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.  á
When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close á
contact with people whom I regard greatly.]

When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility á
of elucidating this.

When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to á
the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this á
short time.

After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's á
place.

When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the á
road.

When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  á
how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical á
book in English that I did not understand.
When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.
Friends who torture animals.
[ Same as in anger.]
When I had my children.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and á
war.
When my child was born.

Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by á
someone close to me.
Failing an examination.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.

When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had á

 understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I á
am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular á
because there is no time for anything else.
When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had á
to learn all on my own.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.
Passed an exam by 2 points.
When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.
Railway station good-bye.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.
I locked myself out.
I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and á
distrusted me.
When I had not understood anything after a lecture.

At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It á
was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have á
such good friends.
Mad at my dad.
A case of unrequited love.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.
When someone stole my bike.

When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I á
thought " Oh God how will I ever manaage it!"

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.  á
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out á
well and we enjoy ourselves.
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
Marriage crises.  Boredom.
When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied á
at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend á
went to Greece for a holiday for a month.

The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of á
economics.

At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by á
cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had á
nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an á
expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering á
problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing á
the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a á
margin of three marks.

When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not á
have a raincoat on me.
When I failed an exam.

When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I á
had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a á
malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.

When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact á
that he had more time to do it than I had.

When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting á
and understood how little one's work was appreciated.

New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the á
steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the á
first time.

The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.  á
He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written á
about.

A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  á
Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.
When I got the loan for my studies.

On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman      á
attacked a group of black people with a whip.

The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in á
English.

When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one á
stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to á
was very negative and not very helpful.
When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a á
year.
Being treated unfairly.
Breaking up with a girl.

When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having á
thought it possible.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got á
very angry.
When my grandmother died.

A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at á
a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the á
sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness á
and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this á
was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the á
lecturer.á

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at á
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our á
interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope á
of human life is sad.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on á
my birthday.

In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to á
wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the á
highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its á
loudest.
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the á
vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really á
surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it á
there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  á
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let á
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning á
in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her á
at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the á
death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I á
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not á
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her á
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking á
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and á
encounter.

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, á
though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could á
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was á
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings á
in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with á
complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the á
hand of the other person, etc...

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how á
they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised á
her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and á
did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by á
mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, á
feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt á
that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.
When I won a tennis match.

When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right á
into the court.
[ No response.]

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in á
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have á
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e á
continously interrupting me by telephoning.
After an exam which I failed.

When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in á
Sk+vde.

When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies á
took liberties, more than what was normal.

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going á
to separate.
Passed the last exam.

I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus á
pass.

My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from á
time to time.
When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.
When I think about my parents getting old.

An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their á
accounts bureau.  They needed "clever people" and he had á
"immediately thought of me."
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.
[ No response.]
When my girlfriend became pregnant.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.
[ No response.]

Long illness.
When I passed an exam.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
The inability to read a book at college.

I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very á
good reference from him.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably á
angry.

When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to á
read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.
When I was finally qualified for my profession.
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.
I stopped working (had a boring job).
Quarrel in the family.

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - á
loneliness drains me.
When I get a hug from someone I love.

My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had á
been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after á
I had already parked.
After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.
When I won an unexpected sum of money.

A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have á
enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    á
at every menstruation.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult á
education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought á
a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.á

When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying á
Psychology because of its low status.

I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He á
was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point á
of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.
When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank á
an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did á
not understand that he had done anything wrong.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and á
soul.

The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks. á
  It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.
I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of á
Psychology.

When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time á
had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long á
time.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying á
that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start á
studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).
When my son was born.

When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and á
my mother took the teacher's point of view.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and á
did not have to do the remaining 5 months.

When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home á
immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have á
easily waited.

When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk á
of her being pregnant.

When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the á
rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a á
friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This á
irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at á
my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly á
angry.

I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits á
and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this á
conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I á
had anticipated.
When I got through the first day here at the department.

When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games á
with a friend.
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
When my mother interfered in my life.

When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for á
it.

When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and á
brought some flowers and cake with him.

When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he á
made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of á
getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the á
job.

When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost á
SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to á
trample on his associates.  I have the misfortune to have one of á
my superiors in my course.

When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two á
children differently.

When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment á
"myself" i.e on my own initiative.

When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a á
performance.  We missed it.

The elections of 1982 and 1985.  The thought of what a social á
democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially "worker á
share" funds and its extension.

When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to á
change the working environment.

When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the á
toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended á
ten times).

When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly á
intead of being criticized by the teacher.

After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed á
and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.

When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the á
South African boycott.

When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died á
later.

When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later á
accepted.

Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly á
irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were á
having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep á
as I had to get up early the next day.

When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I á
had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently á
qualified.

[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.  á
Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being á
here on earth.]

Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and á
very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The á
heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very á
angry.

When I watched the T.V programme called "The living planet" and á
saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man.

On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we á
spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we á
won the jackpot of SEK 1000.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's á
car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was á
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The á
other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our á
relationship by letter.

When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was á
happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to á
have a good time without alcohol.

In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got á
ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these á
marks.

When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.  It was my á
fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.
When I felt that my love was returned.

When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually á
and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up á
to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was á
forced to hide this for a while.

When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without á
any result.

When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling á
me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a á
clinical pilot study.

When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the á
floor.

When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my á
closest friend.

When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was á
very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill á
concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The á
bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been á
using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own á
phone reconnected.

Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and á
nature.
When my 6 month old son is happy and well.
[ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]
When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.
When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her á
husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.

When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see á
her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold á
shoulder.

When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a á
particularly trying period.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.
Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.

When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it á

At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper á

When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
The high school entrance exam.

An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team á
leader.
When my girlfriend left me.

Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between á

A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin á

When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his á

When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the á

When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach me á

When I could not do anything because of a bad back.

When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my á
licence.

I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my á
boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels á
superior to me.

When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it á

continue at college.  I did overreact.
I was very happy when I got an attractive Summer job.
The birth of my child.

When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any á

I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends, á

When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts á

My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for á

In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my á

My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours. á
For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very á

When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We á

I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to á

My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.

After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my á
scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I á
realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left á
the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that á
sloppiness and impudence.

My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and á
also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get á
over it. During all that time I felt very sad.
In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, á

A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were á

Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad á

On meeting an old friend of mine.
During a fight with my best friend.
When my dog died.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when á

At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, á

At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more á

I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the á
car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. á
At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it á

(including rent).

My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly as á

I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was á

Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the á

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and á

When a close relative is treated badly.
When a close friend died.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.

They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got á

When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.
When I fell in love.
A girl I was with went off with another guy.
At set-backs.

When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at á

My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough at á
home.

When I woke up after a nightmare.

When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology á

A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went   á

When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.

After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and á

The sight of a man who ran amok (fighting) at a dance.
When out of work.

When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The á

With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge á

A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer á

When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the á

Someone didn't show up at a meeting in spite of having agreed to á
come.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we á

When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and á
hindered by my cousin.
When my grandfather died.
When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was á
